alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued July 24 at 6:25PM MST until July 24 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 700 PM MST. * At 624 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from near San Tan Valley to near Chandler Heights to near Seville to near Sun Lakes, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 163 and 178. US Highway 60 between mile markers 174 and 210. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 148 and 178. Locations impacted include... Mesa, Chandler, Gilbert, Tempe, Apache Junction, Gold Canyon, Sun Lakes, East Mesa, Queen Creek, Tempe Marketplace, Gold Camp, Falcon Field Airport, San Tan Village Mall, San Tan Valley and Seville. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
